BR_text.BRsummary: `from vision.all import *` overwrites python built-in function `all`
BR_text.BRdescription:
Please confirm you have the latest versions of fastai, fastcore, fastscript, and nbdev prior to reporting a bug (delete one): YES
 Describe the bug
 When you run from vision.all import * the python function all is overwritten.
 To Reproduce
 The following lines through an error
 from fastai.vision.all import *
 all([True, False])
 <denchmark-code>---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
 <ipython-input-3-a22d80fd5ca5> in <module>
       1 from fastai.vision.all import *
 ----> 2 all([True, False])
 
 TypeError: 'module' object is not callable
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Expected behavior
 from fastai.vision.all import *
 all([True, False])
 should return 
 
 I think this happens because <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fastai/fastai/blob/d6f17ba84a6c2f3099611d8119d0eca2c9b88803/fastai/vision/all.py#L8>this line</denchmark-link>
  should not be there. Since there is an <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fastai/fastai/blob/master/fastai/vision/models/all.py>all.py file</denchmark-link>
  inside the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fastai/fastai/tree/master/fastai/vision/models>models folder</denchmark-link>
 ,  overwrites the  function.
 Line 6, in that same file, is already importing the models, so removing line 8 should not affect their import.
 I can delete the line and make a PR, but I am unsure if there should be a test for this and where that test should be.

comments_0.comment_text: A PR would be most welcome :) . Thanks for noting the problem and the fix. I agree your suggested fix looks right.
